member.name: M:IAUEC_Apps.Business.Common.EncryptionClass.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Use this constructor if you are planning to perform encryption/ decryption with 256-bit key, derived using 1 password iteration, hashing without salt, no initialization vector, electronic codebook (ECB) mode, SHA-1 hashing algorithm, and 4-to-8 byte long salt.
member.param: Passphrase from which a pseudo-random password will be derived. The derived password will be used to generate the encryption key. Passphrase can be any string. In this example we assume that the passphrase is an ASCII string. Passphrase value must be kept in secret.
member.remarks: This constructor is not recommended because it does not use initialization vector and uses the ECB cipher mode, which is less secure than the CBC mode.

member.name: M:IAUEC_Apps.Business.Common.EncryptionClass.#ctor(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Use this constructor if you are planning to perform encryption/ decryption with 256-bit key, derived using 1 password iteration, hashing without salt, cipher block chaining (CBC) mode, SHA-1 hashing algorithm, and 4-to-8 byte long salt.
member.param: Passphrase from which a pseudo-random password will be derived. The derived password will be used to generate the encryption key. Passphrase can be any string. In this example we assume that the passphrase is an ASCII string. Passphrase value must be kept in secret.

Initialization vector (IV). This value is required to encrypt the first block of plaintext data. For RijndaelManaged class IV must be exactly 16 ASCII characters long. IV value does not have to be kept in secret.

member.name: M:IAUEC_Apps.Business.Common.EncryptionClass.#ctor(System.String,System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Use this constructor if you are planning to perform encryption/ decryption with 256-bit key, derived using 1 password iteration, hashing without salt, cipher block chaining (CBC) mode, SHA-1 hashing algorithm, and 0-to-8 byte long salt.
member.param: Passphrase from which a pseudo-random password will be derived. The derived password will be used to generate the encryption key Passphrase can be any string. In this example we assume that the passphrase is an ASCII string. Passphrase value must be kept in secret.

Initialization vector (IV). This value is required to encrypt the first block of plaintext data. For RijndaelManaged class IV must be exactly 16 ASCII characters long. IV value does not have to be kept in secret.

Min size (in bytes) of randomly generated salt which will be added at the beginning of plain text before encryption is performed. When this value is less than 4, the default min value will be used (currently 4 bytes).

member.name: M:IAUEC_Apps.Business.Common.EncryptionClass.#ctor(System.String,System.String,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Use this constructor if you are planning to perform encryption/ decryption with 256-bit key, derived using 1 password iteration, hashing without salt, cipher block chaining (CBC) mode, SHA-1 hashing algorithm. Use the minSaltLen and maxSaltLen parameters to specify the size of randomly generated salt.
member.param: Passphrase from which a pseudo-random password will be derived. The derived password will be used to generate the encryption key. Passphrase can be any string. In this example we assume that the passphrase is an ASCII string. Passphrase value must be kept in secret.

Initialization vector (IV). This value is required to encrypt the first block of plaintext data. For RijndaelManaged class IV must be exactly 16 ASCII characters long. IV value does not have to be kept in secret.

Min size (in bytes) of randomly generated salt which will be added at the beginning of plain text before encryption is performed. When this value is less than 4, the default min value will be used (currently 4 bytes).

Max size (in bytes) of randomly generated salt which will be added at the beginning of plain text before encryption is performed. When this value is negative or greater than 255, the default max value will be used (currently 8 bytes). If max value is 0 (zero) or if it is smaller than the specified min value (which can be adjusted to default value), salt will not be used and plain text value will be encrypted as is. In this case, salt will not be processed during decryption either.

member.name: M:IAUEC_Apps.Business.Common.EncryptionClass.#ctor(System.String,System.String,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Use this constructor if you are planning to perform encryption/ decryption using the key derived from 1 password iteration, hashing without salt, cipher block chaining (CBC) mode, and SHA-1 hashing algorithm.
member.param: Passphrase from which a pseudo-random password will be derived. The derived password will be used to generate the encryption key. Passphrase can be any string. In this example we assume that the passphrase is an ASCII string. Passphrase value must be kept in secret.

Initialization vector (IV). This value is required to encrypt the first block of plaintext data. For RijndaelManaged class IV must be exactly 16 ASCII characters long. IV value does not have to be kept in secret.

Min size (in bytes) of randomly generated salt which will be added at the beginning of plain text before encryption is performed. When this value is less than 4, the default min value will be used (currently 4 bytes).

Max size (in bytes) of randomly generated salt which will be added at the beginning of plain text before encryption is performed. When this value is negative or greater than 255, the default max value will be used (currently 8 bytes). If max value is 0 (zero) or if it is smaller than the specified min value (which can be adjusted to default value), salt will not be used and plain text value will be encrypted as is. In this case, salt will not be processed during decryption either.
Size of symmetric key (in bits): 128, 192, or 256.

member.name: M:IAUEC_Apps.Business.Common.EncryptionClass.#ctor(System.String,System.String,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.String)
member.summary: Use this constructor if you are planning to perform encryption/ decryption using the key derived from 1 password iteration, hashing without salt, and cipher block chaining (CBC) mode.
member.param: Passphrase from which a pseudo-random password will be derived. The derived password will be used to generate the encryption key. Passphrase can be any string. In this example we assume that the passphrase is an ASCII string. Passphrase value must be kept in secret.

Initialization vector (IV). This value is required to encrypt the first block of plaintext data. For RijndaelManaged class IV must be exactly 16 ASCII characters long. IV value does not have to be kept in secret.

Min size (in bytes) of randomly generated salt which will be added at the beginning of plain text before encryption is performed. When this value is less than 4, the default min value will be used (currently 4 bytes).

Max size (in bytes) of randomly generated salt which will be added at the beginning of plain text before encryption is performed. When this value is negative or greater than 255, the default max value will be used (currently 8 bytes). If max value is 0 (zero) or if it is smaller than the specified min value (which can be adjusted to default value), salt will not be used and plain text value will be encrypted as is. In this case, salt will not be processed during decryption either.
Size of symmetric key (in bits): 128, 192, or 256.
Hashing algorithm: "MD5" or "SHA1". SHA1 is recommended.

member.name: M:IAUEC_Apps.Business.Common.EncryptionClass.#ctor(System.String,System.String,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Use this constructor if you are planning to perform encryption/ decryption using the key derived from 1 password iteration, and cipher block chaining (CBC) mode.
member.param: Passphrase from which a pseudo-random password will be derived. The derived password will be used to generate the encryption key. Passphrase can be any string. In this example we assume that the passphrase is an ASCII string. Passphrase value must be kept in secret.

Initialization vector (IV). This value is required to encrypt the first block of plaintext data. For RijndaelManaged class IV must be exactly 16 ASCII characters long. IV value does not have to be kept in secret.

Min size (in bytes) of randomly generated salt which will be added at the beginning of plain text before encryption is performed. When this value is less than 4, the default min value will be used (currently 4 bytes).

Max size (in bytes) of randomly generated salt which will be added at the beginning of plain text before encryption is performed. When this value is negative or greater than 255, the default max value will be used (currently 8 bytes). If max value is 0 (zero) or if it is smaller than the specified min value (which can be adjusted to default value), salt will not be used and plain text value will be encrypted as is. In this case, salt will not be processed during decryption either.
Size of symmetric key (in bits): 128, 192, or 256.
Hashing algorithm: "MD5" or "SHA1". SHA1 is recommended.
Salt value used for password hashing during key generation. This is not the same as the salt we will use during encryption. This parameter can be any string.

member.name: M:IAUEC_Apps.Business.Common.EncryptionClass.#ctor(System.String,System.String,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.String,System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Use this constructor if you are planning to perform encryption/ decryption with the key derived from the explicitly specified parameters.
member.param: Passphrase from which a pseudo-random password will be derived. The derived password will be used to generate the encryption key Passphrase can be any string. In this example we assume that the passphrase is an ASCII string. Passphrase value must be kept in secret.

Initialization vector (IV). This value is required to encrypt the first block of plaintext data. For RijndaelManaged class IV must be exactly 16 ASCII characters long. IV value does not have to be kept in secret.

Min size (in bytes) of randomly generated salt which will be added at the beginning of plain text before encryption is performed. When this value is less than 4, the default min value will be used (currently 4 bytes).

Max size (in bytes) of randomly generated salt which will be added at the beginning of plain text before encryption is performed. When this value is negative or greater than 255, the default max value will be used (currently 8 bytes). If max value is 0 (zero) or if it is smaller than the specified min value (which can be adjusted to default value), salt will not be used and plain text value will be encrypted as is. In this case, salt will not be processed during decryption either.
Size of symmetric key (in bits): 128, 192, or 256.
Hashing algorithm: "MD5" or "SHA1". SHA1 is recommended.
Salt value used for password hashing during key generation. This is not the same as the salt we will use during encryption. This parameter can be any string.
Number of iterations used to hash password. More iterations are considered more secure but may take longer.

member.name: M:IAUEC_Apps.Business.Common.EncryptionClass.Encrypt(System.String)
member.summary: Encrypts a string value generating a base64-encoded string.
member.param: Plain text string to be encrypted.
member.returns: Cipher text formatted as a base64-encoded string.

member.name: M:IAUEC_Apps.Business.Common.EncryptionClass.Encrypt(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Encrypts a byte array generating a base64-encoded string.
member.param: Plain text bytes to be encrypted.
member.returns: Cipher text formatted as a base64-encoded string.

member.name: M:IAUEC_Apps.Business.Common.EncryptionClass.EncryptToBytes(System.String)
member.summary: Encrypts a string value generating a byte array of cipher text.
member.param: Plain text string to be encrypted.
member.returns: Cipher text formatted as a byte array.

member.name: M:IAUEC_Apps.Business.Common.EncryptionClass.EncryptToBytes(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Encrypts a byte array generating a byte array of cipher text.
member.param: Plain text bytes to be encrypted.
member.returns: Cipher text formatted as a byte array.

member.name: M:IAUEC_Apps.Business.Common.EncryptionClass.Decrypt(System.String)
member.summary: Decrypts a base64-encoded cipher text value generating a string result.
member.param: Base64-encoded cipher text string to be decrypted.

member.name: M:IAUEC_Apps.Business.Common.EncryptionClass.Decrypt(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Decrypts a byte array containing cipher text value and generates a string result.

member.name: M:IAUEC_Apps.Business.Common.EncryptionClass.DecryptToBytes(System.String)
member.summary: Decrypts a base64-encoded cipher text value and generates a byte array of plain text data.
member.param: Base64-encoded cipher text string to be decrypted.

member.name: M:IAUEC_Apps.Business.Common.EncryptionClass.DecryptToBytes(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Decrypts a base64-encoded cipher text value and generates a byte array of plain text data.

member.name: M:IAUEC_Apps.Business.Common.EncryptionClass.AddSalt(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Adds an array of randomly generated bytes at the beginning of the array holding original plain text value.
member.param: Byte array containing original plain text value.
member.returns: Either original array of plain text bytes (if salt is not used) or a modified array containing a randomly generated salt added at the beginning of the plain text bytes.

member.name: M:IAUEC_Apps.Business.Common.EncryptionClass.GenerateSalt
member.summary: Generates an array holding cryptographically strong bytes.
member.remarks: Salt size will be defined at random or exactly as specified by the minSlatLen and maxSaltLen parameters passed to the object constructor. The first four bytes of the salt array will contain the salt length split into four two-bit pieces.

member.name: M:IAUEC_Apps.Business.Common.EncryptionClass.GenerateRandomNumber(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Generates random integer.
member.returns: Random integer value between the min and max values (inclusive).
member.remarks: This methods overcomes the limitations of .NET Framework's Random class, which - when initialized multiple times within a very short period of time - can generate the same "random" number.
